intro: Pulsatilla bungeana, commonly known as the Bunge's pasqueflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its showy, pale yellow to greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has a short, thick rootstock and produces a rosette of basal leaves that are typically hairy and lobed. It thrives in well-drained, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Pulsatilla bungeana is part of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy and sometimes toxic plants.
